EXTRACTED VALUE: A well-made, technically solid shooter, but its dedication to realism kills the fun. [Aug 2006, p.88]
There are few songs with no improvements over from the last game, and it even plays exactly the same.
That's how it feels: brand extension, dilution rather than enrichment. [Mar 2008, p.102]
Close, but no Robinson's Barley Water. [Issue #7]
There's a good game in Quake 4, but it's buried under several layers of highly disappointing graphical performance issues.
It’s well put together, a joy to behold and a marvel to look at, but it’s just a lot of never ending sameness.
Although fun for a while, Full Auto isn't the type of game which you can spend hours upon hours playing.
